trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Freshdesk | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Freshdesk | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Freshdesk with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Freshdesk with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Freshdesk
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory Integration with Freshdesk

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Freshdesk.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Freshdesk.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Freshdesk tenant
trans-unit.target: A Freshdesk tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Freshdesk will be able to single sign into the application at your Freshdesk company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Freshdesk will be able to single sign into the application at your Freshdesk company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Freshdesk
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Freshdesk

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Freshdesk
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Freshdesk

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Freshdesk.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Freshdesk.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Freshdesk, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Freshdesk, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Freshdesk.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Freshdesk.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Freshdesk, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Freshdesk, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Freshdesk</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Freshdesk</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Freshdesk with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Freshdesk with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Freshdesk requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Freshdesk requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Freshdesk application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Freshdesk application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Freshdesk page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Freshdesk page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Freshdesk Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\.Freshdesk.com*", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Freshdesk Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "*https://\.Freshdesk.com*", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Freshdesk page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Freshdesk.cer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Freshdesk page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally as c:\\Freshdesk.cer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Freshdesk company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Freshdesk company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the General Settings tab, click Security.
trans-unit.target: In the General Settings tab, click Security.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Security section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Security section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For Single Sign On (SSO), select On.
trans-unit.target: For Single Sign On (SSO), select On.

trans-unit.source: Select SAML SSO.
trans-unit.target: Select SAML SSO.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Freshdesk dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Freshdesk dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the SAML Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Freshdesk dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Freshdesk dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Security Certificate Fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Security Certificate Fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Freshdesk, they must be provisioned into Freshdesk.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Freshdesk, they must be provisioned into Freshdesk.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Freshdesk, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Freshdesk, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To provision a user accounts, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To provision a user accounts, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Freshdesk tenant.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Freshdesk tenant.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Admin.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Admin.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Admin</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Admin</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the General Settings tab, click Agents.
trans-unit.target: In the General Settings tab, click Agents.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Agents</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Agents</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New Agent.
trans-unit.target: Click New Agent.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Agent</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Agent</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Agent Information dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Agent Information dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Agent Information</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Agent Information</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Full Name textbox, type the name of the Azure AD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Full Name textbox, type the name of the Azure AD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: In the Email textbox, type the Azure AD email address of the Azure AD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email textbox, type the Azure AD email address of the Azure AD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: In the Title textbox, type the title of the Azure AD account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Title textbox, type the title of the Azure AD account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Select Agents role, and then click Assign.
trans-unit.target: Select Agents role, and then click Assign.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD account holder will get an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it is activated.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD account holder will get an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it is activated.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Freshdesk user account creation tools or APIs provided by Freshdesk to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Freshdesk user account creation tools or APIs provided by Freshdesk to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Freshdesk, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Freshdesk, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Freshdesk **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Freshdesk **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
